title: METHONE
content:
METHONE was the Naiad-nymph of the spring, well or fountain of the town of Methone in Pieria (northern Greece).
        She was the wife of Pieros (Pierus), the eponymous founding-king of the country.

OIAGROS (by Pieros) (Of the Origin of Homer & Hesiod Frag 1)

Homerica, Of the Origina of Homer and Hesiod and their Contest, Fragment 1 (trans.
          Evelyn-White) (Greek epic B.C.) :
        "From Pieros (Pierus) and the Nymphe Methone sprang Oiagros (Oeagrus)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
